skillTree.localised_description: Enables the Skeletal Steed (Mount)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The world lies in disarray, ripe with strife, tainted by foul magics, depraved religions and loathsome deities that offend our gods. We´ll not stop until we crush all those false kings and bring order and civilization to all lands.

effects.description:
Magic Resistance: 3% for Construct units
	(Lord's army)

Magic Resistance: 6% for Construct units
	(Lord's army)

Magic Resistance: 10% for Construct units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Liche High Priest has performed hundreds of thousands of rituals in life and in undeath, the magics needed to keep an entire army marching and fighting forever being like a second nature to them.
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Symbolising immortality and eternity, the ruler of the Nehekharan Pantheon has always had a care for the wellbeing of his children.

skillTree.localised_description: "They stand staring into the sun for eternity, the physical embodiment of the everlasting gods. Terrible ye who looked into their divine forms!"

skillTree.localised_name: Usirian the God of the Underworld
skillTree.localised_description: Those who oppose the faceless God of the Underworld shall suffer terribly, condemned to its lowest levels for eternity.

skillTree.localised_name: Asaph the Goddess of Magic & Vengeance
skillTree.localised_description: They who serve the Asp Goddess are blessed with a precise aim with which to reach their objectives.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Ignorants and fools believe even our lands belong to them, but the gods gave them to us for all eternity. Let none escape their holy wrath!
Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

skillTree.localised_description: Neru, goddess of Protection, preserves the borders of Nehekhara with a legion of animated monuments.

skillTree.localised_description: The god of Earth infuses the most magnificent of constructs with strength and hardness. Often, this is enough to level walled fortresses to the ground and withstand otherwise fatal onslaughts.

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +15% for Skeleton Archers, Ushabti (Great Bows), Skeleton Horse Archers, Screaming Skull Catapult and Bone Giant units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: The desert itself is his steed.

skillTree.localised_description: A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.

skillTree.localised_description: The very strength of the desert, to stand sentinel over the Tomb Kings' domain and crush their enemies to dust.

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
"Revered One, Venerable One, Lord of Secrets, High Priest of the Temple of Years…"
The people of the desert live and die by their oaths in Basth's graceful sight.
The God of the Scorpions protects the venal, the perfidious, and the downright murderous.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +5%
	(Heroes in local province)

Melee attack: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Tomb Kings and their servants feel Khsar's wrath coursing through their Unliving veins.
Unlife is forever; it is therefore prudent to go willingly and prepared.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Vulture-God assists the desert poozler, lest they lose their way 'neath the scorching desert sun.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +3%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
